modules.description: This module manages parallel task execution across multiple domains. It provides operations to set up and tear down domain pools, run tasks synchronously or asynchronously, and perform parallel computations such as for-loops, reductions, scans, and searches over integer ranges or arrays. These functions are used to distribute compute-intensive workloads like numerical simulations, bulk data processing, or search algorithms across multiple domains efficiently.

This module implements thread-safe channels for inter-domain communication, supporting both bounded and unbounded buffering. It provides blocking and non-blocking send and receive operations to coordinate data transfer between domains. Use cases include implementing producer-consumer patterns and synchronizing shared state across domains.

Implements thread-safe channels for inter-domain communication with blocking and non-blocking send/receive operations on bounded and unbounded buffers, used for producer-consumer coordination and shared state synchronization. Manages parallel task execution across domains with domain pools, supporting parallel for-loops, reductions, scans, and searches over integer ranges and arrays. Targets compute-intensive workloads such as numerical simulations, bulk data processing, and search algorithms.
